title: ‘Bach: The Six Partitas’ by Mahan Esfahani and ‘Duruflé: Complete Organ Works’ by Thomas Trotter Reviews: Beyond the Piano
sub_head: Keyboards come in many attractive varieties, as evinced by new harpsichord and organ recordings.
body: Mahan Esfahani, whose new album, “Bach: The Six Partitas,” was just released on Hyperion, wants to restore the harpsichord to the classical mainstream, where its position was usurped two centuries ago by the piano. He’s been trying to transform its antiquated image in different ways, commissioning works from living composers and combining old and new music in performances, as he did to excellent effect on “Time Present and Time Past,” his 2015 album with the Baroque ensemble Concerto Köln for Archiv Produktion.
